name: ibm-blockchain-platform
description: End to end extension for Hyperledger Fabric developers. Develop and test your blockchain smart contracts and client applications on your local machine, and package your projects for deployment into IBM Blockchain Platform runtimes.
author: IBMBlockchain

fabric.gateways.description: Gateways for connecting to a Blockchain network

fabric.wallets.description: Wallets for connecting to a Blockchain network

fabric.runtime.description: Configurations for the local Blockchain managed runtime

blockchain.ext.directory.description: Configurations for IBM Blockchain extension directory

blockchain.repositories.description: Repositories for accessing samples stored on disk

extension.home.showOnStartup.description: Show home page when clicking on extension for the first time

program.description: Path to the program folder (or any file within that folder) when in 'debug' or 'test' mode, and to the pre-built binary file to debug in 'exec' mode.

args.description: Command line arguments passed to the program.

showLog.description: Show log output from the delve debugger.

cwd.description: Workspace relative or absolute path to the working directory of the program being debugged. Default is the current workspace.

env.description: Environment variables passed to the program.

buildFlags.description: Build flags, to be passed to the Go compiler.

init.description: Init file, executed by the terminal client.

remotePath.description: If remote debugging, the path to the source code on the remote machine, if different from the local machine.

port.description: The port that the delve debugger will be listening on.

host.description: The host name of the machine the delve debugger will be listening on.

trace.description: Various levels of logging shown in the debug console. When set to 'log' or 'verbose', the logs will also be written to a file.

envFile.description: Absolute path to a file containing environment variable definitions.

backend.description: Backend used by delve. Only available in delve version 0.12.2 and above.

output.description: Output path for the binary of delve

logOutput.description: Comma separated list of components that should produce debug output.

followPointers.description: FollowPointers requests pointers to be automatically dereferenced

maxVariableRecurse.description: MaxVariableRecurse is how far to recurse when evaluating nested types

maxStringLen.description: MaxStringLen is the maximum number of bytes read from a string

maxArrayValues.description: MaxArrayValues is the maximum number of elements read from an array, a slice or a map

maxStructFields.description: MaxStructFields is the maximum number of fields read from a struct, -1 will read all fields

dlvLoadConfig.description: LoadConfig describes to delve, how to load values from target's memory

apiVersion.description: Delve Api Version to use. Default value is 2.

stackTraceDepth.description: Maximum depth of stack trace collected from Delve

showGlobalVariables.description: Boolean value to indicate whether global package variables should be shown in the variables pane or not.

projectName.description: The preferred project in which the debugger searches for classes. There could be duplicated class names in different projects. This setting also works when the debugger looks for the specified main class when launching a program. It is required for expression evaluation.

mainClass.description: The fully qualified class name (e.g. [java module name/]com.xyz.MainApp) or the java file path of the program entry.

args.description: The command line arguments passed to the program.

vmArgs.description: The extra options and system properties for the JVM (e.g. -Xms<size> -Xmx<size> -D<name>=<value>).

modulePaths.description: The modulepaths for launching the JVM. If not specified, the debugger will automatically resolve from current project.

classPaths.description: The classpaths for launching the JVM. If not specified, the debugger will automatically resolve from current project.

sourcePaths.description: The extra source directories of the program. The debugger looks for source code from project settings by default. This option allows the debugger to look for source code in extra directories.

encoding.description: The file.encoding setting for the JVM. If not specified, 'UTF-8' will be used. Possible values can be found in http://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/technotes/guides/intl/encoding.doc.html.

cwd.description: The working directory of the program. Defaults to the current workspace root.

env.description: The extra environment variables for the program.

stopOnEntry.description: Automatically pause the program after launching.

enumDescriptions: VS Code debug console (input stream not supported).
External terminal that can be configured in user settings.
console.description: The specified console to launch the program.

enumDescriptions: Launch the program with the standard command line 'java [options] classname [args]'.
Generate the classpath parameters to a temporary classpath.jar file, and launch the program with the command line 'java -cp classpath.jar classname [args]'.
Generate the classpath parameters to a temporary argument file, and launch the program with the command line 'java @argfile [args]'. This value only applies to Java 9 and higher.
Automatically detect the command line length and determine whether to shorten the command line via an appropriate approach.
shortenCommandLine.description: When the project has long classpath or big VM arguments, the command line to launch the program may exceed the maximum command line string limitation allowed by the OS. This configuration item provides multiple approaches to shorten the command line.

stepFilters.description: Skip specified classes or methods when stepping.

classNameFilters.description: Skip the specified classes when stepping. Class names should be fully qualified. Wildcard is supported.

skipStaticInitializers.description: Skip static initializer methods when stepping.

program.description: Absolute path to a text file.

args.description: The arguments to give to the Fabric runtime

env.description: The environment variables to give to the Fabric runtime

sourceMaps.description: Use JavaScript source maps (if they exist).

outFiles.description: If source maps are enabled, these glob patterns specify the generated JavaScript files. If a pattern starts with '!' the files are excluded. If not specified, the generated code is expected in the same directory as its source.

smartStep.description: Automatically step through generated code that cannot be mapped back to the original source.

skipFiles.description: An array of file or folder names, or glob patterns, to skip when debugging.

trace.description: When 'true', the debugger will log tracing info to a file. When 'verbose', it will also show logs in the console.
